question: Which country's oldest known human settlement is known as the "Pulli Settlement"?
explanation: Pulli settlement is the oldest known human settlement in Estonia. This settlement is located on the right bank of the Parnu River of Estonia. Pulli has settled around 11,000 years ago, at the beginning of the 9th millennium BC. A dog tooth found at the Pulli settlement is the first evidence for the existence of the domesticated dog in the territory of Estonia
